item.title: Todd add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "If you don't have time to read, you don't have the time (or the tools) to write. Simple as that." -- Stephen King

item.title: Todd add a quote by Nora Roberts
item.description: "You can fix anything but a blank page." -- Nora Roberts

item.title: Todd add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "Ideas are like rabbits. You get a couple and learn how to handle them, and pretty soon you have a dozen." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Todd add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "You must keep sending work out; you must never let a manuscript do nothing but eat its head off in a drawer. You send that work out again and again, while you're working on another one. If you have talent, you will receive some measure of success - but only if you persist." -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: Todd add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "A scrupulous writer, in every sentence that he writes, will ask himself at least four questions, thus: 1. What am I trying to say? 2. What words will express it? 3. What image or idiom will make it clearer? 4. Is this image fresh enough to have an effect?" -- George Orwell

item.title: Todd add a quote by Philip Pullman
item.description:
"I don't profess any religion; I don't think it’s possible that there is a God; I have the greatest difficulty in understanding what is meant by the words ‘spiritual’ or ‘spirituality.'
[<i>Interview, The New Yorker, Dec. 26, 2005</i>]" -- Philip Pullman

item.title: Todd add a quote by Harlan Ellison
item.description: "The only thing worth writing about is people. People. Human beings. Men and women whose individuality must be created, line by line, insight by insight. If you do not do it, the story is a failure. [...] There is no nobler chore in the universe than holding up the mirror of reality and turning it slightly, so we have a new and different perception of the commonplace, the everyday, the 'normal', the obvious. People are reflected in the glass. The fantasy situation into which you thrust them is the mirror itself. And what we are shown should illuminate and alter our perception of the world around us. Failing that, you have failed totally." -- Harlan Ellison

item.title: Todd add a quote by Till Lindemann
item.description: "Loneliness sometimes gives me a quantity of creativeness - you're drinking another glass of wine and you're feeling even worse. Art doesn't work without pain; art also exists for compensating pain." -- Till Lindemann

item.title: Todd add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Tomorrow may be hell, but today was a good writing day, and on the good writing days nothing else matters." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Todd add a quote by Red Smith
item.description: "There's nothing to writing. All you do is sit down at a typewriter and open a vein." -- Red Smith

item.title: Todd add a quote by philip pullman
item.description:
"I'm trying to undermine the basis of Christian belief... I'm not in the business of offending people. I find the books upholding certain values that I think are important, such as life is immensely valuable and this world is an extraordinarily beautiful place. We should do what we can to increase the amount of wisdom in the world.
[<i>Washington Post interview, 19 February 2001</i>]" -- philip pullman

item.title: Todd add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Todd add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Todd add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Truth is stranger than fiction, but it is because Fiction is obliged to stick to possibilities; Truth isn't." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Todd add a quote by Gustave Flaubert
item.description: "Do not read, as children do, to amuse yourself, or like the ambitious, for the purpose of instruction. No, read in order to live." -- Gustave Flaubert

item.title: Todd add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Books serve to show a man that those original thoughts of his aren't very new after all." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Todd add a quote by Horace Mann
item.description: "A house without books is like a room without windows." -- Horace Mann

item.title: Todd add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "Literature is a luxury; fiction is a necessity." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Todd add a quote by Garrison Keillor
item.description: "A book is a gift you can open again and again." -- Garrison Keillor

item.title: Todd add a quote by Jeanette Winterson
item.description: "Book collecting is an obsession, an occupation, a disease, an addiction, a fascination, an absurdity, a fate. It is not a hobby. Those who do it must do it. Those who do not do it, think of it as a cousin of stamp collecting, a sister of the trophy cabinet, bastard of a sound bank account and a weak mind." -- Jeanette Winterson

item.title: Todd add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Even in literature and art, no man who bothers about originality will ever be original: whereas if you simply try to tell the truth (without caring twopence how often it has been told before) you will, nine times out of ten, become original without ever having noticed it." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Todd add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "We have come from God, and inevitably the myths woven by us, though they contain error, will also reflect a splintered fragment of the true light, the eternal truth that is with God. Indeed only by myth-making, only by becoming 'sub-creator' and inventing stories, can Man aspire to the state of perfection that he knew before the Fall. Our myths may be misguided, but they steer however shakily towards the true harbour, while materialistic 'progress' leads only to a yawning abyss and the Iron Crown of the power of evil." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Todd add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Fairy tales are more than true: not because they tell us that dragons exist, but because they tell us that dragons can be beaten." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Todd add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Good books don't give up all their secrets at once." -- Stephen King

item.title: Todd add a quote by Allan Bloom
item.description: "The failure to read good books both enfeebles the vision and strengthens our most fatal tendency -- the belief that the here and now is all there is." -- Allan Bloom

item.title: Todd add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "If all printers were determined not to print anything till they were sure it would offend nobody, there would be very little printed." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Todd add a quote by John Witherspoon
item.description: "Never read a book through merely because you have begun it." -- John Witherspoon

item.title: Todd add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "It is with books as with men: a very small number play a great part." -- Voltaire

item.title: Todd add a quote by Joan Bauer
item.description: "My grandma always said that God made libraries so that people didn't have any excuse to be stupid." -- Joan Bauer

item.title: Todd add a quote by Annette Hoggs-Jackson
item.description: "In order to know who you are you need to know God is." -- Annette Hoggs-Jackson
